clinical_study.brief_title: Proximal Femoral Fractures - Patient Population, Risk Factors, Surgical Performance and Outcome
clinical_study.official_title: Proximal Femoral Fractures - Patient Population, Risk Factors, Surgical Performance and Outcome

brief_summary.textblock:
Proximal femoral fractures are a typical pathology in elderly patients after a low-energy trauma.
This study analyses preexisting risk factors for proximal femoral fractures as well as for failing to reach the previous functional level, difference in outcome between patients with femoral neck fracture compared to those with pertrochanteric fracture, surgical performance and its significance for the functional outcome, as well as the impact of proximal femoral fractures on patients' one-year independence.

primary_outcome.time_frame: from date of surgery until 1 year follow up period after surgery
at 1 year follow up date after surgery
during hospitalization (from date of surgery until discharge date after surgery (approx. 1-3 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Quantification of major complications with documentation of affected organ System, intensive care Treatment, Discharge where to (home, home with support, in-patient rehabilitation, nursing home), length of hospital stay

primary_outcome.time_frame: from date of surgery until 1 year follow up period after surgery
from date of surgery until 1 year follow up period after surgery
from date of surgery until 1 year follow up period after surgery
primary_outcome.description: Quantification of deaths and date of death

primary_outcome.time_frame: at 1 year follow up date after surgery
primary_outcome.description: Change in use of walking aids

primary_outcome.time_frame: at 1 year follow up date after surgery
at 1 year follow up date after surgery
at 1 year follow up date after surgery
primary_outcome.description: Change in restrictions in daily living (yes/no),

primary_outcome.time_frame: at 1 year follow up date after surgery
during hospitalization (from date of surgery until discharge date after surgery (approx. 1-3 weeks)
during hospitalization (from date of surgery until discharge date after surgery (approx. 1-3 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Quantification of Discharge where to (home, home with support, in-patient rehabilitation, nursing home)

primary_outcome.time_frame: during hospitalization (from date of surgery until discharge date after surgery (approx. 1-3 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Quantification of length of hospital stay

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in patient clinical outcome (according Penrod score)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: preoperatively and at 1 year follow up date after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Penrod score reflects the patients' preoperative functional level and living. Patients are classified concerning their prefracture age (1: <75 years, 2: 75-84 years, 3 ≥85 years, their ability in performing activities of daily life (ADL) as well as their cognitive status (dementia in clusters 2B and 3D Situation)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in radiological outcome: assessment of surgical treatment of pertrochanteric fractures
secondary_outcome.time_frame: day of surgical intervention (immediately after surgery) and 1year postoperative (if n.a. min 6 months postoperative)
secondary_outcome.description: central positioning and insertion of the neck screw

secondary_outcome.measure: radiological outcome: assessment of surgical treatment of femoral neck fractures
secondary_outcome.description: development of periacetabular ossification according to Brooker A islands of bone within the soft tissues about the hip B bone spurs originating from the pelvis or proximal end of the femur, leaving at least 1 cm between opposing bone surfaces C bone spurs originating from the pelvis or proximal end of the femur, reducing the space between opposing bone surfaces to less than 1 cm D bone ankylosis of the hip

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in subsidence (radiological outcome: assessment of surgical treatment of femoral neck fractures)
secondary_outcome.description: differences in the distance between perpendicular lines drawn to the bisecting axis of the medullary canal, at the top of the femoral head and at the tip of the great trochanter in mm

secondary_outcome.measure: radiological outcome: assessment of surgical treatment of femoral neck fractures
secondary_outcome.description: cortical atrophy i.e. longitudinal intracortical porosis with a consecutive thinning of the cortex without measurable thickening of the femur (yes-no-n.a.)

secondary_outcome.measure: radiological outcome: assessment of surgical treatment of femoral neck fractures
secondary_outcome.description: osteolysis i.e. progressive, newly developed endosteal bone loss with a diameter > 3 mm, either with scalloping or a bead-shaped lucency at the cement-bone interface

secondary_outcome.measure: radiological outcome: assessment of surgical treatment of femoral neck fractures
secondary_outcome.description: debonding i.e. radiolucent line at the prosthesis-cement interface not visible on the first postoperative radiograph (yes-no-n.a.)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in radiological outcome: assessment of surgical treatment of pertrochanteric fractures
secondary_outcome.time_frame: day of surgical intervention (immediately after surgery) and 1year postoperative (if n.a. min 6 months postoperative)
secondary_outcome.description: leg-length discrepancy (tangent to inferior pubic rami and tip of greater trochanter, if n.a. insertion of lesser trochanter)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in radiological outcome: assessment of surgical treatment of femoral neck fractures
secondary_outcome.time_frame: day of surgical intervention (immediately after surgery) and 1year postoperative (if n.a. min 6 months postoperative)
secondary_outcome.description: leg-length discrepancy in mm (tangent to inferior pubic rami and tip of greater trochanter, if n.a. insertion of lesser trochanter)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in radiological outcome: assessment of surgical treatment of femoral neck fractures
secondary_outcome.time_frame: day of surgical intervention (immediately after surgery) and 1year postoperative (if n.a. min 6 months postoperative)
secondary_outcome.description: alignment on ap view (central axis of the distal stem to bisecting axis of medullary canal at the isthmus) in °

arm_group.description: patients with proximal femoral fracture (type: femoral neck fracture) with surgical procedure: partial hip arthroplasty
patients with proximal femoral fracture (type:pertrochanteric femoral fractures) with surgical procedure: intramedullary nail type Gamma® Nail or similar

intervention.description: surgical treatment for proximal femoral fracture with intramedullary nail type Gamma® Nail or similar in case of pertrochanteric fractures
surgical treatment for proximal femoral fracture with a partial hip arthroplasty in case of femoral neck fractures

study_pop.textblock: Patients treated for a proximal femoral fracture at the University Hospital Basel between 01.08.2009 and 31.07.2018

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- surgery with intramedullary nail type Gamma® Nail or similar in case of pertrochanteric fractures or
- with a partial hip arthroplasty in case of femoral neck fractures
Exclusion Criteria:
- Clinical follow up at another institution
- Documented dissent in study participation

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Orthopaedics and Trauma Surgery (DOTS).

facility.name: Department of Orthopaedics and Trauma Surgery (DOTS).

clinical_study.keyword: risk factor for proximal femoral fracture
